subject: Re: [junit] Problem in the test suite
msgSnippet: ... I would recommend that you arrange the tests as follows: public class TestAllMethods { public static Test suite() { long maxTimeExpected = 2500; TestSuite
messageBody:
On Jan 9, 2005, at 12:14 AM, Harbir wrote:

> I have a bit of problem here, the following the code of the
> performance test that using the Junitpref.
>
> when i run the following test, it fails and Junit shows the followng
> message:
> -------------------------------------------------------------
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests found in
> au.com.iman.web.test.TestAll
> at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
> at junit.framework.TestSuite$1.runTest(TestSuite.java:263)
>
> --------------------------------------------------------------
> The following is the code for the Suite, i guess there is a problem in
> the suite, but i am not able to figure it out,,, Please help with
> this. What I want to do is run a performace test on two test methods
> that are in other suite(MyWebtest).
> ----------------------------------------------------------------
>
> import com.clarkware.junitperf.TimedTest;
>
> import junit.framework.Test;
> import junit.framework.TestSuite;
>
>
> public class TestAllmethods{
> public static Test suite(){
>
> return new TestSuite(TestAllmethods.class);
>
> }
>
> public void testClaimsBrowserStatusofone(){
> long maxTimeexpected=2500;
>
> Test test1=new MyWebtest("testClaimsBrowseByStatusup");
> Test test11=new TimedTest(test1,maxTimeexpected);
> }
>
> public void testClaimsBrowserStatus11(){
> long maxTime=2500;
>
> Test test1=new MyWebtest("testClaimsBrowseByStatus11");
> Test test11=new TimedTest(test1,maxTime);
> }
> }
>

I would recommend that you arrange the tests as follows:

public class TestAllMethods {

public static Test suite() {

long maxTimeExpected = 2500;

TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();

Test test1 = new MyWebtest("testClaimsBrowserStatusofone");
Test timedTest1 = new TimedTest(test1, maxTimeExpected);
suite.addTest(timedTest1);

Test test2 = new MyWebtest("testClaimsBrowserStatus11");
Test timedTest2 = new TimedTest(test2, maxTimeExpected);
suite.addTest(timedTest2);

return suite;
}
}
